        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<span class="line"><!---->The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<!----></span><br>2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<span class="line"><!---->2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<span class="line"><!---->. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<!----></span><br>   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<span class="line"><!---->   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<!----></span><br><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    "ExtensionSettings": {<span class="line"><!---->    "ExtensionSettings": {<!----></span><br>      "*": {<span class="line"><!---->      "*": {<!----></span><br>        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<span class="line"><!---->        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<!----></span><br>         "blocked_permissions": []<span class="line"><!---->         "blocked_permissions": []<!----></span><br>       }<span class="line"><!---->       }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<span class="line"><!---->  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<!----></span><br>   * Windows - <span class="line"><!---->   * Windows - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<!----></a><br>   * macOS - <span class="line"><!---->   * macOS - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<!----></a><br>   * Linux - <span class="line"><!---->   * Linux - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<!----></a><br><br><br>3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<span class="line"><!---->3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<!----></span><br>4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<!----></span><br>5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<span class="line"><!---->5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://example.com"><!---->example.com<!----></a> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>6. Visit<span class="line"><!---->6. Visit<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a><br><br>Expected:<span class="line"><!---->Expected:<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> should not be modified.<span class="line"><!----> should not be modified.<!----></span><br><br>Actual:<span class="line"><!---->Actual:<!----></span><br>- BAD:<span class="line"><!---->- BAD:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>- (good:<span class="line"><!---->- (good:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<span class="line"><!----> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<span class="line"><!---->PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<!----></span><br><br>One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<span class="line"><!---->One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<!----></span><br><br>A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<span class="line"><!---->A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<!----></span><br><br>I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<span class="line"><!---->I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I haven't had the bandwidth to dig into this one much, and might not in the immediate future.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't had the bandwidth to dig into this one much, and might not in the immediate future.<!----></span><br><br>Karan, can you take a look?  <span class="line"><!---->Karan, can you take a look?  <!----></span>Comment #6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c6"><!---->Comment #6<!----></a> has some possible approaches.       </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Rubber Stamper: The change is not in the configured time window. Rubber Stamper is only allowed to review cherry-picks within 14 day(s). Learn more:<span class="line"><!---->Rubber Stamper: The change is not in the configured time window. Rubber Stamper is only allowed to review cherry-picks within 14 day(s). Learn more:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>go/rubber-stamper-user-guide<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/rubber-stamper-user-guide"><!---->go/rubber-stamper-user-guide<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        </span>

          </tbody>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<span class="line"><!---->The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<!----></span><br>2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<span class="line"><!---->2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<span class="line"><!---->. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<!----></span><br>   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<span class="line"><!---->   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<!----></span><br><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    "ExtensionSettings": {<span class="line"><!---->    "ExtensionSettings": {<!----></span><br>      "*": {<span class="line"><!---->      "*": {<!----></span><br>        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<span class="line"><!---->        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<!----></span><br>         "blocked_permissions": []<span class="line"><!---->         "blocked_permissions": []<!----></span><br>       }<span class="line"><!---->       }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<span class="line"><!---->  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<!----></span><br>   * Windows - <span class="line"><!---->   * Windows - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<!----></a><br>   * macOS - <span class="line"><!---->   * macOS - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<!----></a><br>   * Linux - <span class="line"><!---->   * Linux - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<!----></a><br><br><br>3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<span class="line"><!---->3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<!----></span><br>4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<!----></span><br>5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<span class="line"><!---->5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://example.com"><!---->example.com<!----></a> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>6. Visit<span class="line"><!---->6. Visit<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a><br><br>Expected:<span class="line"><!---->Expected:<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> should not be modified.<span class="line"><!----> should not be modified.<!----></span><br><br>Actual:<span class="line"><!---->Actual:<!----></span><br>- BAD:<span class="line"><!---->- BAD:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>- (good:<span class="line"><!---->- (good:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<span class="line"><!----> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Devlin, I'd rather keep the logic of chrome.debugger-specific permission checks down to the absolute minimum and try to rely on the common extension permission checks to the extent possible. Is there a better way to check URL access than we do here? <span class="line"><!---->Devlin, I'd rather keep the logic of chrome.debugger-specific permission checks down to the absolute minimum and try to rely on the common extension permission checks to the extent possible.           Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by

        PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<span class="line"><!---->PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<!----></span><br><br>One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<span class="line"><!---->One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<!----></span><br><br>A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<span class="line"><!---->A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<!----></span><br><br>I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<span class="line"><!---->I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I haven't had the bandwidth to dig into this one much, and might not in the immediate future.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't had the bandwidth to dig into this one much, and might not in the immediate future.<!----></span><br><br>Karan, can you take a look?  <span class="line"><!---->Karan, can you take a look?  <!----></span>Comment #6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c6"><!---->Comment #6<!----></a> has some possible approaches.  I think for the near term, it might be best to start with the simplest approach of checking IsPolicyBlockedHost() directly in the debugger API, and then subsequently checking if we could include that more directly in IsRestrictedURL().<span class="line"><!----> has some possible approaches. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)

        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<span class="line"><!---->The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<!----></span><br>2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<span class="line"><!---->2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<span class="line"><!---->. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<!----></span><br>   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<span class="line"><!---->   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<!----></span><br><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    "ExtensionSettings": {<span class="line"><!---->    "ExtensionSettings": {<!----></span><br>      "*": {<span class="line"><!---->      "*": {<!----></span><br>        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<span class="line"><!---->        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<!----></span><br>         "blocked_permissions": []<span class="line"><!---->         "blocked_permissions": []<!----></span><br>       }<span class="line"><!---->       }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<span class="line"><!---->  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<!----></span><br>   * Windows - <span class="line"><!---->   * Windows - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<!----></a><br>   * macOS - <span class="line"><!---->   * macOS - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<!----></a><br>   * Linux - <span class="line"><!---->   * Linux - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<!----></a><br><br><br>3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<span class="line"><!---->3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<!----></span><br>4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<!----></span><br>5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<span class="line"><!---->5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://example.com"><!---->example.com<!----></a> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>6. Visit<span class="line"><!---->6. Visit<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a><br><br>Expected:<span class="line"><!---->Expected:<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> should not be modified.<span class="line"><!----> should not be modified.<!----></span><br><br>Actual:<span class="line"><!---->Actual:<!----></span><br>- BAD:<span class="line"><!---->- BAD:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>- (good:<span class="line"><!---->- (good:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<span class="line"><!----> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          manifest.json<b><!---->manifest.json<!----></b>

        Devlin, I'd rather keep the logic of chrome.debugger-specific permission checks down to the absolute minimum and try to rely on the common extension permission checks to the extent possible. Is there a better way to check URL access than we do here? <span class="line"><!---->Devlin, I'd rather keep the logic of chrome.debugger-specific permission checks down to the absolute minimum and try to rely on the common extension permission checks to the extent possible. Is there a better way to check URL access than we do here? <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc;drc=1ca6a4e6f1506c9f8cad9e3151608582e145b923;l=101<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc;drc=1ca6a4e6f1506c9f8cad9e3151608582e145b923;l=101"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc;drc=1ca6a4e6f1506c9f8cad9e3151608582e145b923;l=101<!----></a><br><br>Shouldn't this API account for the policy overrides?<span class="line"><!---->Shouldn't this API account for the policy overrides?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      rdevl...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1119303457" title="rdevl...@chromium.org"><!---->rdevl...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      rdevl...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->rdevl...@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        on
        
      Wed, Nov 18, 2020, 7:07 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 18, 2020, 7:07 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 18, 2020, 7:07 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 18, 2020, 7:07 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          NextAction:<strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<span class="line"><!---->PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<!----></span><br><br>One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<span class="line"><!---->One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<!----></span><br><br>A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<span class="line"><!---->A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<!----></span><br><br>I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<span class="line"><!---->I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rob@robwu.nl (Oct 15, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<span class="line"><!---->The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<!----></span><br>2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<span class="line"><!---->2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<span class="line"><!---->. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<!----></span><br>   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<span class="line"><!---->   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<!----></span><br><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    "ExtensionSettings": {<span class="line"><!---->    "ExtensionSettings": {<!----></span><br>      "*": {<span class="line"><!---->      "*": {<!----></span><br>        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<span class="line"><!---->        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<!----></span><br>         "blocked_permissions": []<span class="line"><!---->         "blocked_permissions": []<!----></span><br>       }<span class="line"><!---->       }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<span class="line"><!---->  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<!----></span><br>   * Windows - <span class="line"><!---->   * Windows - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<!----></a><br>   * macOS - <span class="line"><!---->   * macOS - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<!----></a><br>   * Linux - <span class="line"><!---->   * Linux - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<!----></a><br><br><br>3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<span class="line"><!---->3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<!----></span><br>4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<!----></span><br>5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<span class="line"><!---->5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://example.com"><!---->example.com<!----></a> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>6. Visit<span class="line"><!---->6. Visit<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a><br><br>Expected:<span class="line"><!---->Expected:<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> should not be modified.<span class="line"><!----> should not be modified.<!----></span><br><br>Actual:<span class="line"><!---->Actual:<!----></span><br>- BAD:<span class="line"><!---->- BAD:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>- (good:<span class="line"><!---->- (good:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<span class="line"><!----> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 18, 2020, 7:07 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>

          NextAction:<strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<span class="line"><!---->PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<!----></span><br><br>One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<span class="line"><!---->One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<!----></span><br><br>A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<span class="line"><!---->A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<!----></span><br><br>I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<span class="line"><!---->I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
