      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<span class="line"><!---->The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<!----></span><br>2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<span class="line"><!---->2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<span class="line"><!---->. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<!----></span><br>   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<span class="line"><!---->   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<!----></span><br><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    "ExtensionSettings": {<span class="line"><!---->    "ExtensionSettings": {<!----></span><br>      "*": {<span class="line"><!---->      "*": {<!----></span><br>        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<span class="line"><!---->        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<!----></span><br>         "blocked_permissions": []<span class="line"><!---->         "blocked_permissions": []<!----></span><br>       }<span class="line"><!---->       }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<span class="line"><!---->  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<!----></span><br>   * Windows - <span class="line"><!---->   * Windows - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<!----></a><br>   * macOS - <span class="line"><!---->   * macOS - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<!----></a><br>   * Linux - <span class="line"><!---->   * Linux - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<!----></a><br><br><br>3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<span class="line"><!---->3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<!----></span><br>4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<!----></span><br>5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<span class="line"><!---->5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://example.com"><!---->example.com<!----></a> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>6. Visit<span class="line"><!---->6. Visit<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a><br><br>Expected:<span class="line"><!---->Expected:<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> should not be modified.<span class="line"><!----> should not be modified.<!----></span><br><br>Actual:<span class="line"><!---->Actual:<!----></span><br>- BAD:<span class="line"><!---->- BAD:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>- (good:<span class="line"><!---->- (good:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<span class="line"><!----> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Devlin, I'd rather keep the logic of chrome.debugger-specific permission checks down to the absolute minimum and try to rely on the common extension permission checks to the extent possible. Is there a better way to check URL access than we do here? <span class="line"><!---->Devlin, I'd rather keep the logic of chrome.debugger-specific permission checks down to the absolute minimum and try to rely on the common extension permission checks to the extent possible. Is there a better way to check URL access than we do here? <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc;drc=1ca6a4e6f1506c9f8cad9e3151608582e145b923;l=101<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc;drc=1ca6a4e6f1506c9f8cad9e3151608582e145b923;l=101"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc;drc=1ca6a4e6f1506c9f8cad9e3151608582e145b923;l=101<!----></a><br><br>Shouldn't this API account for the policy overrides?<span class="line"><!---->Shouldn't this API account for the policy overrides?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          NextAction:<strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<span class="line"><!---->PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<!----></span><br><br>One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<span class="line"><!---->One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<!----></span><br><br>A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<span class="line"><!---->A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<!----></span><br><br>I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<span class="line"><!---->I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 10<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by

Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<span class="line"><!---->The ExtensionSettings.*.runtime_blocked_hosts Enterprise policy is supposed to prevent extensions from accessing web content at the given hosts, regardless of the permissions declared by the extension. This is however not enforced for the chrome.debugger extension API. This allows extensions to bypass the security restrictions as configured by the enterprise policy.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 86.0.4240.75 (stable) + 88.0.4294.0 (latest canary)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Tested with Linux, but applies to any.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files (manifest.json, background.js, contentscript.js) and put it in a directory - the extension directory.<!----></span><br>2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<span class="line"><!---->2. Create an Enterprise policy to block a domain, e.g.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<span class="line"><!---->. I believe that this policy is already active for Googlers, so if you are a Googler you could skip this step.<!----></span><br>   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<span class="line"><!---->   To configure on Chromium for Linux, put the following in /etc/chromium/policies/managed/block-google.json:<!----></span><br><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    "ExtensionSettings": {<span class="line"><!---->    "ExtensionSettings": {<!----></span><br>      "*": {<span class="line"><!---->      "*": {<!----></span><br>        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<span class="line"><!---->        "runtime_blocked_hosts": ["*://*.google.com"],<!----></span><br>         "blocked_permissions": []<span class="line"><!---->         "blocked_permissions": []<!----></span><br>       }<span class="line"><!---->       }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<span class="line"><!---->  For Chrome or other platforms, see:<!----></span><br>   * Windows - <span class="line"><!---->   * Windows - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015<!----></a><br>   * macOS - <span class="line"><!---->   * macOS - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517624<!----></a><br>   * Linux - <span class="line"><!---->   * Linux - <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7517525<!----></a><br><br><br>3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<span class="line"><!---->3. Start Chrome and visit chrome://policy to verify that the policy is active.<!----></span><br>4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and select the directory from step 1.<!----></span><br>5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<span class="line"><!---->5. Visit an unrelated domain such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://example.com"><!---->example.com<!----></a> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> to see that the extension is active. It will turn the page yellow and replace the content with "Added by content script" and "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>6. Visit<span class="line"><!---->6. Visit<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a><br><br>Expected:<span class="line"><!---->Expected:<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> should not be modified.<span class="line"><!----> should not be modified.<!----></span><br><br>Actual:<span class="line"><!---->Actual:<!----></span><br>- BAD:<span class="line"><!---->- BAD:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<span class="line"><!----> became yellow and contains "Added by chrome.debugger API"<!----></span><br>- (good:<span class="line"><!---->- (good:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com/robots.txt<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com/robots.txt"><!---->google.com/robots.txt<!----></a> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<span class="line"><!----> does not have "Added by content script", as expected: i.e. the policy was partially effective)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 18, 2020, 7:07 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1139156#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 18, 2020, 7:07 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          NextAction:<strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2020-11-23
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<span class="line"><!---->PermissionsData::IsRestrictedUrl() essentially checks if the URL is off-limits to all extensions by the Chrome browser, rather than off-limits to the extension.  Most access checks should use CanAccessPage() (which is actually called out here [1]).  Unfortunately, I don't think that works well with the debugger permission, which more implicitly grants access to everything (rather than explicitly adding host permissions).<!----></span><br><br>One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<span class="line"><!---->One possibility would be to roll the policy host checks into IsRestrictedUrl().  I haven't done an audit of the other callsites to see whether that would make sense or not.<!----></span><br><br>A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<span class="line"><!---->A simple-and-safe, though somewhat ugly, solution would be to check IsPolicyBlockedHost() in addition to IsRestrictedUrl() - that would probably be the path of least resistance (and what I'd start with, particularly, if we'd want to merge this back).<!----></span><br><br>I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<span class="line"><!---->I won't be able to tackle this issue this week, but might be able to next week.  If anyone else can jump sooner, feel free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/permissions/permissions_data.h;l=97;drc=efba8d2927574721d8e9c39c444a0c363694c312<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.         I've just been told that the TPM that approved the merge can add a TPM override. Hopefully that person is subscribed to this thread.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

 });
 </script>


 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
